title: Every game seems one-sided .. no really like EVERY game.
body:
Hey all ,

So I've noticed something since I've been playing in this new preseason, every single game has been one-sided.  I hear this all the time, and I usually think it's over exaggerating because I agree that some games are one-sided, but I've always still had some great games that get down to the wire and were decided based on a good pick, or someone mechanically outplaying in a big fight, or some decision making with a quick baron call, etc..  but I have literally been recording the past 15 games I've played (on another account, gold 2 rated) and 15 out of 15 games were one-sided, win or lose. EVERY GAME!!!

I really try to look at the bright side of most situations in my life, but I just can't find these games fun anymore.  One thing that I've always enjoyed about this game, is that _laning phase doesn't decide the game._  You always know in the back of your mind, that later on in teamfights or from good calls, you have a chance to come back, which gives you the drive and motivation to keep your head up and keep playing, and having that drive turns losing games into games that are still fun and enjoyable (most of the time they are even more fun than just stomping your opponent from the 5 min mark)

Why would Riot ever think this is a better approach to a game like this? Like I said I've played 15 games in a row and recorded how they all went, just so I had something to support my argument.  14 out of the 15 games, the team who got the first 2 turrets, won the game.  The one game where this didn't happen, my team got our 2nd tower about 1 minute after they got their 2nd, and after we got our 2nd tower, the snowball began. Maybe I have the worst luck in history, cause 15 games really is a lot of games in league.. but judging by the posts, I'm not alone on this feeling.

The thing that drew me to this game was the huge fights that would actually end with 1 or 2 people alive, and the unpredictable outcomes of each game.  I'm really depressed that the game has turned into a snowball fest every single game, and there's no mystery anymore.  I've even noticed more annoyed angry players who give up because frankly when you lost your inhib at 14 minutes, what can you really do? Defend your base while they go grab the rift/baron and they 5 man another lane against your 4 people (while one is still defending the missing inhib lane).. it's sad.  This approach might work better for other games, but League of Legends needs to be a longer game, it only makes sense on how it was designed (there's champs that are only supposed to be good past 30 minutes!!) 

Anyway, I would love to hear everyone's opinions on this issue. Do you like the shorter games? Are you still having great games? Please let me know!

TL:DR- After recording 15 games, every single game was one-sided. This is very unenjoyable for a game like League, considering some champs and items are meant to be good after 25-30 minutes of the game. Also it feels like laning phase decides the game, and that is one thing I've always been afraid of happening. The mystery and excitement is gone , or is barely there.. and since the beginning of season 7, it just seems to get worse and worse.

I think the issue is matchmaking. I have long suspected that Riot has an algorythm that controls the winning team. Notice how you win a few games and your feeling good, suddenly you are teamed with people who likely don't know what keyboards are for. The reason for this is to control spiking mmr and ip gains. By intentionally gaming the system they allow players to climb or prevent them from climbing in ranked. Yes I know it sounds very conspiracy theoryish, but it's actually quite sound logic. Why? Because good players are teamed with really bad ones to make the bad ones feel like they have a chance and so that they continue to play and buy skins down the road. But how can a good player teamed with a bad one guarentee a win? Matchmaking them with 2 even worse opponents. 

I know this does sound crazy. But look at the players ranks when playing ranked. You will notice that one team clearly seems imbalanced, despite a small shuffle making it more balanced. Yes I know I put a tinfoil hat on, but dammit I want to believe!

The old Rune pages were designed to encourage (or even force) the player to split their power between attack, defense, and sustain.  This meant that a lane that was going poorly still had their armor/MR/mana regen runes to fall back on.

The new rune pages severely punish players for failing to go all-in with min/maxing.  If you're a mage, assassin, or fighter, you darn well better take two damage branches that synergize with each other, or else the total value of your runes don't get to multiply with each other and you just lose.  This means that the vast majority of solo lanes are all-in on damage

Compounding the issue is the fact that only half of one rune branch is devoted to survival... and even those options just don't work as a secondary rune page (it's all "increase your defenses by a percentage of your defenses," worthless to a control mage or late game marksman).  There is no way to be a min/maxed tank because there isn't a second rune branch that assists a tank, and no good way to survive a lane that you anticipate not-winning.

In short, every lane is forced to go all-in, and after that one mandated fight is done, the lane is unsalvageable for the loser.  It's not fun for anybody.
